awd_titl_txt: Acquisition of a Rapid-Quench Cold-Seal Pressure Apparatus
awd_abstract_narration: 9526338  Lange         This grant awards $16,610 as one-half of the costs  of acquiring equipment necessary to construct a  rapid-quench, cold-seal pressure apparatus for  experimental petrological research to be conducted  at the University of Michigan.  Specifically, the  system will be used to synthesize volatile-bearing  silicate liquids at low pressures (<300 MPa).  These samples will then be used for low-  temperature (<1000 degrees C) measurements of  density, thermal expansion, viscosity, and heat  capacity.  In situ density (sink/float) and  viscosity (falling sphere) experiments will also  be conducted using volatile-bearing silicate  liquids.  These experiments will allow precise  determination of the partial molar volume of water  and other volatiles in silicate melts.  ***
